Rules as Guidance Solution

How we revolutionized the architect workflow by merging plan creation and subtask generation into a single iterative step, preserving context and ensuring perfect alignment.

Before: Context Loss Architecture

Step 1: Plan Creation ✓ Correct

Creates correct implementation plan with full context

⚠️ CONTEXT BOUNDARY ⚠️
Step 2: Subtask Creation ✗ Context Lost

Creates generic validation tasks, not actual work

Problems:

  • • Context lost between steps
  • • Generic subtasks created
  • • User intent ignored
  • • Wasted execution time

After: Context Preservation Architecture

Single Iterative Step:

1
Get comprehensive task context
2
Create/update implementation plan
3
Immediately create subtasks (context fresh!)
4
Validate alignment with task goals
5
Refine if needed (iterative!)

Benefits:

  • • Context preserved throughout
  • • Subtasks align with actual work
  • • User intent maintained
  • • Efficient execution

Real Implementation Results

❌ Old Subtasks (Context Lost):

Subtask 12: "Codebase Analysis Validation"
→ Created validation-script.js

Subtask 13: "Content Structure Analysis"
→ Created content-analysis-script.js

Subtask 14: "Business Value Validation"
→ Created business-value-validation-script.js

Subtask 15: "Quality Gate Definition"
→ Created quality-gates-definition.js

✅ New Subtasks (Context Preserved):

→ Actually update memory-bank/ProjectOverview.md

→ Actually update memory-bank/TechnicalArchitecture.md

Subtask 18: "Update DeveloperGuide.md"
→ Actually update memory-bank/DeveloperGuide.md

Subtask 19: "Update README.md"
→ Actually update README.md
Perfect alignment: User request → Implementation plan → Actual subtasks
